fields.description:
Greetings,\\
I am wondering if it is possible to have the wiki folder inside the repository for all of my projects.

Regards\\
Bogdan
fields.summary: wiki folder inside the repository

fields.description:
See the screenshot.

This is caused by italicized lines having 1px extra height than normal lines and accumulating down the page.
fields.summary: Source view of a file has line numbers misaligned with lines in Firefox on Windows (BB-6210)

fields.description:
I'd like to have an image for my account but I see no way. It say's use gravatar.com, so I signed up for that, but there is still no way that I can change or have ANY image for my account.

Any help would be much appreciated. Thanks!
fields.summary: Image / Gravatar

fields.description: We don't currently output any comment information in the feeds for a repository.
fields.summary: Include commit and/or pull request comments in a repository's RSS feed (BB-6211)

fields.description:
The source browser no longer has a way in the UI to browse source at a sepcific revision.

The workaround for now is to place the revision hash into the URL

https://bitbucket.org/USER/REPP/src/HASH
fields.summary: Bring back ability to browse at a specific revision (BB-6197)

fields.description: When on custom domain, the comment submission page is a 404 when i try to submit a comment on a changeset.
fields.summary: Unable to post comment on a commit on custom domain.

fields.description:
Comments made using the web portal always show in the dashboard and other news feeds. Comments made by replying on a notification email are added to the correct issue but they don't show up in the news feeds.

Is this intentional? I would prefer to also see these _replies_ in the feeds.
fields.summary: Replies on comments via email don't show up in news feeds, including dashboard (BB-6208)

fields.description: If I report issues to many projects, or am a developer on many projects, I would like to have a global view of all the issues I've reported or I am working on, without having to manually drill down into every single project that I'm involved with.
fields.summary: Global "my issues" view

fields.description:
# Do not log in
# Open any project
# Try to "Follow"

Expected result:\\
Some message/popup suggesting to login
fields.summary: there is no "login required" message if click "Follow" unlogged (BB-6195)

fields.description:
Available for pygments:\\
https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/pygments-main/pull-request/61/julia-lexer/activity
fields.summary: Upgrade pygments so we get Julia syntax highlighting support (BB-6194)

fields.description: the one designated admin was never accepted - "not invited" or similar
fields.summary: couldnt sign up

fields.description:
I am having issues locally, I don't know whether it's supposed to do this but every time I create a new branch from the master branch it re commits every commit made from the first commit on the master branch.\\
Is there a way to stop this?
fields.summary: Branching issues local

fields.description:
I noticed issue BCLOUD-4859 was resolved earlier, so this must have been a known problem. There are still some links that don't work though. Specifically:

* Deleting / Marking a comment on an issue as spam
* Issue links within an issue description/comment
* Links to changesets from an issue description (using the tool)

There may be more, but these are the ones I've notices so far.
fields.summary: Some links don't work when using custom domain (BB-6193)

fields.description:
If someone of your team decline a pull request by mistake, you can't revert this operation even if your are the owner/manager of the repository with all admin rights. The alternative is to retry with a new pull-request, with the caveat of producing a spurious duplicate of the former pull-request.

In addition, it seems also strange that a pull request can be declined even if all participants have approved it !
fields.summary: Ability to reopen a declined pull request

fields.description: See attached image.
fields.summary: Wiki markup for the ordered lists stopped working in the issue descriptions

fields.description: In news feeds, comments on issues use the same icon as pull requests, not the one used for creation or editing of issues. I would expect it to use the issue icon with either the edit badge or a special badge for comments. I've attached a screenshot of what I'm seeing.
fields.summary: in newsfeed, issue comments use pull request icon (BB-6191)

fields.description:
When trying to comment on a line of code or showing more lines of code, from a custom domain, the request fails due to being a request to a different domain.

XMLHttpRequest cannot load https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/hora-de-la-papa/changesets/f3287d4d707a1e3827cf37d42a6a41158cb80827/_context/application/models/user.php?above_fnum=30&above_tnum=30. Origin http://g.20d.mx is not allowed by Access-Control-Allow-Origin.
fields.summary: Commenting and showing more lines not working when using custom domain. (BB-6190)

fields.description: We have a repository for UnityScript which is not in the language dropdown.  Maybe add a feature to allow us to add a custom language?
fields.summary: Add Custom Languages to Repository

fields.description: Currently the events Resources have five different issue-related event types: issue_update, issue_comment, report_issue, start_follow_issue and stop_follow_issue. Now, the comment-related ones have a comment id in their description field, but none of them have an issue id. Please add issue ids to all issue-related events. And while at it, issue titles would also be a nice addition so that you don't need to make another API call just to get those.
fields.summary: Include issue number in issue-related events with the Events API (BB-6165)

fields.description: Landscape mode is not working. This causes me to need to take my Ipad out of my zagg folio to play.
fields.summary: Landscape

fields.description: Main screen with multiple documents – “Date” is selected for the list/sort by, but the documents are not listed by date. Pressing Name, they all alphabetize. Then press Date and they correctly line up by date. It’s just leaving the program and coming back in that it doesn’t organize them correctly.
fields.summary: List/Sort By setting is not sorting correctly when app is opened

fields.description:
I'm currently trying to accept a pull-request but it always results in a 500 internal server error on this url:

POST: https://bitbucket.org/mediamonks/..reponame../pull-request/6/update-16-10-2012/fulfill\\
Guru meditation: 7d73b71ad2184474983ed2a26081112c$7eeb91517219778bc27c04ec514271f3

I've also tried it with the owning account and different browsers but it doesn't seem to help.

Any information would be appreciated :-)!
fields.summary: Accepting a pull-request results in 500 internal server error.

fields.description:
I removed a users's access and it sent them an alert stating " Notification: Your access on [repo name] has been revoked."

I would have preferred that either no email was sent or that I had the option to skip sending the email.  I needed to remove the user without them knowing about it.
fields.summary: Make sending a notification optional when removing user access (BB-13620)

fields.description:
See http://screencast.com/t/u1xGgLWn

h1. You need to enter the search text twice to get the results
* first time searching for "commit" changes only the Date column [0:17]
* the text field changes to "test"

h1. The input box dissapears of there are no search results.
If I want to fix my search query I have to hit Back button first and search again from there.
fields.summary: Bug in commit searching, you must submit twice to get results (BB-6150)

fields.description:
A username (author) name above a specific length is not displayed on the "Commits" page beside that person's commit details. The "author" column is left blank.\\
One of the users has a name 25 characters long and this is no longer displayed. It is not even truncated either, it is just blank. A user name of 14 is displayed in full.\\
However, if the commit details are examined (i.e. drilled into) the author name appears correctly on this page.
fields.summary: Author name not appearing on commit if over specific length

fields.description:
tl;dr the attachment says it all.\\
I think the following happened. I entered my email address in capitals, somehow bitbucket changed it to lower case as it knew capitals don't matter, but also kept the capitalized one. Now I have both alex.tesfamichael@gmail.com and Alex.Tesfamichael@gmail.com listed as mail addresses linked to my account. Resending verification doesn't help. Removing is impossible due to both being my primary email according to bitbucket(and this is technically right).
fields.summary: Capitals in email address causing trouble (BB-6064)

fields.description: Changing username resets all my acivity and the dashboard treats me as a new user asking me to create my first repository, even though I already have some repositories.
fields.summary: Changing 'username' resets my activity and repos (BB-6153)

fields.description:
Hi,

We've been using Bitbucket for our company lately and just started using the issue tracker.

We've come across a missing feature (at least, we haven't found it yet) which we think would be valuable:

Is there a place where all open issues across repositories can be viewed?\\
Either assigned to the logged in user of unassigned issues.

Right now you can only see issues when you go to a repository. But wouldn't it be easier if there would be a section on the dashboard that shows all issues assigned to you ordered by priority?
fields.summary: Create an overview of all open issues

fields.description:
Hi! Problem is that there is too many notifications in first page. It would be great to separate notifications by categories - which to show and which not.\\
For example, I following some projects but I want to see only updates or new issue update but not who started to follow and who ended.\\
And it would be great to separate inside project.
fields.summary: Notification categories (check to which I agree) (BB-2821)

fields.description:
Hello,

As OOo4Kids and OOoLight maintainer, I'd like to tell you the licence you are using for OOo4Kids-core is plain wrong.

BTW, if you want to checkout the most recent sources, please use our official repository.

svn co svn.Adullact.org/svnroot/ooo4kids1/trunk  my_OOo4Kids

Last but not least, configure using --with-OOo4Kids will build OOo4Kids, and use --with-OOoLight instead (both flags are exclusive), will build ooolight

More information:  https://adullact.net/projects/ooo4kids1/

Thanks\\
ericb at ooo4kids dot org
fields.summary: OOo4Kids is LGPL

fields.description:
It would seem that downloading any file from a repository causes the HTTP response header to contain the same content-type: text/plain

For example:

curl -i -u thedillonb https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/thedillonb/bitbucketbrowser/raw/master/BitbucketBrowser/Images/Dropbar.png

Results in:

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8

Which is incorrect since the png is not text...
fields.summary: HTTP Content-Type is always text/plain (BB-6154)

fields.description:
Hi folk,

Well done on a great interface you have created.

One small omission is the ability to edit after you have Previewed a comment.

Let's say you have an almost beautiful looking comment done with markdown, you preview and of course - damn there's that typo.

Now you have two options - cancel (not a good way to go as I found out) or comment.... but now you have published the comment.  Yes you can go and edit, but the post will have already been emailed to who knows who, and when you fix your comment they will get it all over again - that begins to feel spammy.

So an edit option to take you back into typing mode from the preview would do the trick.

Cheers\\
Andrew
fields.summary: Comment preview needs an edit option (BB-6155)

fields.description:
I have a README.md file in my repository that shows images on the GitHub UI but shows as <a href="*** on Bitbucket ui.\\
It would be great if this feature could come here to Bitbucket.
fields.summary: README <a href***
Profile username title offsets [Fedora 17, Chrome 21] (BB-6161)

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to be able to see who is watching a given issue or not, especially within Bitbucket Teams.

Ideally, the number of watchers would be linked to a list or jquery poppup, so if there were 2 watchers, the number 2 would be a link to the list of the 2 people watching the given issue.

Thanks!

Jason
fields.summary: Link number of watchers to a list of users watching the issue. (BB-6162)

fields.description: It would be great if the user could instruct the issues comment parser to highlight code syntaxes without inserting 4 spaces before each row. This feature was available before the new parser by using {{{ and }}}
fields.summary: Markdown syntax highlighting in issues comments for complete blocks

fields.description: Please, make it possible to specify description (formatted text) and release / due date when create a milestone.
fields.summary: Make it possible to specify description and due date for milestones (BB-6137)

fields.description: When adding an SSH key that is invalid or too long, provide the user with useful feedback as to why.
fields.summary: Better warning error message for adding an SSH key (BB-6135)

fields.description:
If you use a colon in a URL for a link on the README, the resulting link when the page is rendered won't be correct.

To workaround, escape any special characters in the URL. For example, a : can be replaced with %3A.
fields.summary: Colons in the link URL of Markdown text don't get rendered correctly (BB-5921)

fields.description: The Bitbucket importer doesn't support using SSH protocol due to technical contraints. There should be an error message indicating this to prevent users from accidentally using this.
fields.summary: Add error message on repo importer for SSH protocol (BB-6133)

fields.description:
When creating a new team on sign-up, any administrator users need to already be signed up. You cannot create a team against an email address as an admin.

The error when someone tries to assign an email address as an administrator should be clearer. Perhaps a message such as:

You must assign at least one existing Bitbucket user as an administrator.
fields.summary: Give better warning or error on Team signup (BB-6131)

fields.description:
The markdown documentation (*) indicates that HTML may be used if the element is "separated from surrounding content by blank lines, and the start and end tags of the block should not be indented with tabs or spaces." This does not seem to work for 
.  Let's try it here:


Before and after.

Hmmm.

(*) http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax#html
fields.summary: HTML in issuetracker

fields.description:
A link on the page https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+Wiki+Markup\\
leads to an error message.

The link is: http://wiki.wikicreole.org/Creole%201.0/additions

Thank you.
fields.summary: Broken link on Using Wiki Markup page

fields.description: Uploading from bitbucket.org works just fine, but attempting to upload from a custom DNS record sends you to the URL https://bbuseruploads.s3.amazonaws.com/ and results in a weird XML error response message: {code} #!xml AccessDenied Invalid according to Policy: Policy Condition failed: ["eq", "$success_action_redirect", "http://customdomain.com/username/repo/downloads/add"] HEX gibberish {code}
fields.summary: Upload of downloads fail on CNAME'd site

fields.description:
When first accessing the Commits page, file dates are shown in ISO format. After a while they flip to relative time format (6 days ago). Is this intentional?

Chrome on Mac OS X.
fields.summary: Date format changes on 'Commits' page (BB-6207)

fields.description:
It would be nice to know who has read a changeset.  We use peer reviewing a lot, and require that at least 2 developers (other than the committer) read every changeset.  Right now, it is impossible to tell if anyone has looked at a change set unless there is a comment or it has been improved.  Our rule is that you only approve if you do not find fault, otherwise you comment.  In order for us to tell f the 2 dev rule has been met, the second dev has to add a "me too" if they have no further comments...

Perhaps adding the dev or user as a participant with an eye icon (like the approve checkmark icon) if they have read but not commented or approved?  This would also help scrum masters identify if people are actually taking part in the review process.
fields.summary: Keep track of users who have viewed a changeset (BB-6132)

fields.description:
Hi!

HOw can I resend invitation? If didn't the man get it?
fields.summary: Resend invitation (BB-3472)

fields.description:
Removing the $ prepended to each line would make it much quicker for anyone to copy and paste some commands to get their repo into Bitbucket. I have to copy and paste two times while trying to precisely align my mouse as to not copy the $s. Hence, why not remove the $s, copy just once and paste?

As for $, I don't believe it to be a major loss.
fields.summary: Remove $s in commands to run on "Import an existing repository"

fields.description:
I tried everything I could.  I could not get my group to update. Update A Group\\
Steps to reproduction (using Fiddler2)

# Set HTTP Method to PUT
# Set url to https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/groups/steinerd/test-2/ (which is a valid group, also attempted the email for account name)
# Set the Authorization header to the base64 encoded username:password it expects
# Set Content-Length header to 0 (and also tested with the correct byte size of the request data, same result)
# Set Request body to name=New+Group+Test&permission=admin&auto_add=true (I also tried with %20 for spaces and no encoding, same results)

I know that PUT sends a 302 upon success by design... but for a handful of them it was forwarding off to the return URL but didn't actually change anything.
fields.summary: "Update a Group" Api Endpoint Does not update

fields.description: Currently, the type of events you wish to load using the API is specified using the type parameter, for example, "?type=commit". Now, if I wanted to get all other events but not commits, I'd currently have to make about thirty calls to the API, as it appears you cannot negate the call ("?type=!commit") or specify many types at once ("?type=fork&type=issue_update"). So, please add the possibility to negate the type and to specify multiple types at once.
fields.summary: More types in one Events API call (BB-6138)

fields.description:
At the top of the account management page, there is a dropdown containing my username. I'm not sure what it's for, as it doesn't open.

Unrelatedly, I'm really loving the new redesign. Really nice work!
fields.summary: Account switcher should not be a dropdown when you are not a member of any teams (BB-6136)

fields.description:
On this particular project, I've created milestones as such: 2.5.x, 2.6.x, 3.x.

In the admin interface, the milestones appear listed in this (natural) order, as expected. However, in the tracker, when sorting the issues by Milestone, the observed order is 2.5.x, 3.x, 2.6.x
fields.summary: Issue tracker: weird ordering of milestones

fields.description: The Overview page lists bookmarks as branches but the Downloads page does not. It is not consistent.
fields.summary: Include Hg bookmarks on the Downloads page (BB-6139)

fields.description:
If I push --force to redo a branch for a pull request, the activity tab says "oops, something has gone horribly wrong".

It would be very nice to maintain the comments and inline comments in the activity tab for a pull request. Quite often at my day job we respond to pull request review by redoing the branch. This keeps our history cleaner, rather than filling it with a number of small commits.

On github, there's no way to see inline comments on commits from previous versions of the pull request branch. If Bitbucket was able to provide that under the activities tab, that would be a big advantage.
fields.summary: Pull requests can't handle push --force (BB-6129)

fields.description:
Just check the following screenshot...

http://box.jisko.net/i/b590b2ee.png
fields.summary: Repository admin page broken layout

fields.description:
# select a story - now you are in notes
# close the app by pressing windows or search button
# press back button to open the app again

There is no pictures in Notes
fields.summary: there is no pictures in notes

fields.description:
I have my repository marked as private, but my issue tracker marked as public, yet on the issue tracker pages, the "Clone", "Fork", "Compare" and "Pull Request" buttons are still visible (and thus display some info I don't want seen).

Either hiding these buttons (for non-approved and not logged in users) automatically when a repository is private or allowing us control over who has access to see them would be fantastic.

As a side-node, being able to White Label the Issue Tracker on paid plans would be _amazing_.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Ability to hide Clone/Fork/Compare/Pull Request buttons (BB-6101)

fields.description:
When I try to search for repositories, it should be possible to specify which programming languages I am interested in.

For example, when I search for 'rails', it shows me .Net stuff as well. If could specify 'ruby' as a programming language, then I could limit the results to just those repositories that mention 'rails' and which are written in 'ruby'.
fields.summary: Enable searh by programming language

fields.description:
When creating many issues we dont have a button 'new issue' just after creating one. So that we have to click on tab 'issues', wait for loading, and then click on 'new issue'.

Please, provide the "new issue" button for a faster and more confortable work.
fields.summary: Add a button 'new issue' just after create a new one

fields.description:
^ ^ ^\\
| | |\\
| | |\\
The line in above is the problem.

Please, see the attachment for better understanding.

Maybe it would be better to fade the text or even put it in another place cause this prejudice the easy reading of the description turning it a bit confuse.
fields.summary: Mixing medata of issue with its description

fields.description:
It would be really nice to be able of defining some templates for issues so that, on create issues, after change its type, the template would be filled in its description.

I think it would be specially useful for bug issues, but to have the option for change others would be good too.
fields.summary: Templates for each type of issue

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be *very very useful* to have some place where we could set default options for 'assigne', 'type' and so on.

It is *very* boring to have to set them in each new issue.

Params:

* Kind
* Priority
* Component
* Asignee
fields.summary: Default parameters for issue's options (BB-3526)

fields.description:
I am trying to import httplib2 from googlecode using the import

I choose google code\\
and the project name httplib2.. The system fills in the https://httlib2.googlecode.com/hg link

I hit the import button.. and it complains that the URL is missing.
fields.summary: Importing repo from google code gives missing field

fields.description:
you're detecting key stroke before enabling the send button..  which fails if you cut and paste an email ... also not clear how to send multiple invites (i figure comma separated, but this doesnt seem valid)

Left as major cause I think it will affect your desire to sign people up
fields.summary: send invite cut and paste email doesnt work (BB-6164)

fields.description:
On [https://bitbucket.org/OpenUru_org/cwe-ou/pull-request/18|https://bitbucket.org/OpenUru_org/cwe-ou/pull-request/18] I get an error message “Oops! Something has gone terribly wrong...” on all three tabs (Diff/Commits/Activity). In particular, I can no longer see the discussion that happened on this pull request, which makes me a bit queasy, because those discussions are important information regarding traceability of the development of the project. The participants icons at the top right still show the involved people though, so I’m hopeful that no data has been lost.

The problem appeared with the new site design, in the old design the discussion was visible.

It most likely has something to do with the fact that the source branch of this pull request was mistakenly deleted by its owner a while ago. I’m also not sure why the pull request is marked “declined” (though that may not be Bitbucket’s fault), as far as I am concerned it is open and will be accepted soon.

(As as side note, I would also consider it a bug that the commits disappeared from the pull request when they were removed from the source repository. In my opinion, the pull request should keep a reference to them, no matter whether they are still present in the source repository. But that already happened in the old design and is not part of this bug report.)
fields.summary: “Something has gone terribly wrong” on pull request from deleted branch (BB-6129)

fields.description:
The page looks like this:

h2. *Notifications*
https://bitbucket.org/ If enabled, this will send notifications when issues are raised.

* The URL _https://bitbucket.org/_ seems superfluous...

Cheers
fields.summary: Strange text content on PROJECT/admin/issues/notifications

fields.description: [Emoji|http://www.emoji-cheat-sheet.com/] doesn't work in comments on commits like described in [Linking to Bitbucket Objects from Comments - Linking to non-repository objects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Marking%2Bup%2BComments#MarkingupComments-LinkingtoBitbucketObjectsfromComments]
fields.summary: Emoji and url linking do not work in comments (BB-6166)

fields.description:
* Links to user accounts (here: authors of issue comments) use the custom URL as well, while they should be using bitbucket.org (like on Overview page).
* When embedding changeset links via the toolbar, the custom URL gets used. That's ok, but it must not include the user/account name in that case since it's already part of the custom URL.

Cheers
fields.summary: Custom URL: wrong mapping in issue context (BB-6167)

fields.description:
most of my repositories have some 3 languages. bump that if you're going to count markup.

what's the point in selecting one?
fields.summary: why i have to select ONE language for my repo?

fields.description: No way to open the profile menu to access any item in there, and found no other route to work around.
fields.summary: can't log out on Android

fields.description:
I am not able to sign up a team using the page at https://bitbucket.org/account/signup/

I fill in all the fields and add two team members using their email addresses, one admin and one normal, click Sign Up and I get bounced with this error message: "You must add at least one member. These admins are not invited team members: [member's email address removed for privacy]". This happens in both Opera 12.02 and Firefox 3.5.16 under Linux and IE8 under Windows. I have tried just adding one team member and no team members with no success.
fields.summary: Team sign-up page is broken

fields.description:
From a support request:

bq. Allow the defaults for "type" and "priority" to be set (we use "minor"\\
as our default priority and "task" as our default type)
fields.summary: Allow cumtomizable default values for new issues

fields.description: None of the menus in Opera open, you click and they take you to the dashboard. I am using Opera 12.02 Build 1578 for Linux i386.
fields.summary: Menus do not open in Opera

fields.description: Tried to enter a new SSH Key, but was unable to Save it. I also tried changing an existing key and was unable to save the update. I tried to do this using both Chrome (v22) and FireFox (v15).
fields.summary: BB Ajax calls helpfully convert hex usernames to decimal (BB-6217)

fields.description: After pushing today I realized that the website didn't getting updated and showing feed as usual. Look at the screenshot for more details. The TortoiseHg shows that I have already pushed but there no such change sets in web site.
fields.summary: Change logs do not appear in website after pushing

fields.description: Web site says there are no ssh keys for the account.  When I go to add my key, it says the key is already used.
fields.summary: SSH Keys
Mail group support for repository

fields.description: As described.
fields.summary: "What is a fork" link on fork page broken

fields.description: The google analytics for repositories was accidentally removed in the UI redesign. This issue is to serve as the notification when this has been brought back.
fields.summary: Bring back Google analytics service support (BB-6115)

fields.description: The commit hash is difficult to select due to the line height of the committer information below the commit hash on the single commit view.
fields.summary: Commit hash is difficult to select (BB-6114)

fields.description:
I found it by hacking the URL I got from searching.. the link I want is:

https://bitbucket.org/repo/all

And it should be in the main nav bar.
fields.summary: No general "browse all public repositories" or "explore" link...

fields.description: There is an issue on the Plans and billing page where, when removing users, the count isn't updated until you manually refresh the page. This can cause some confusion.
fields.summary: When removing users on Plans and Billing, the count doesn't update until a manual page refresh (BB-6112)
No warning for being over the plan limit (BB-6111)

fields.description: When choosing a language for a repo, one of the options is haXe. This reflects the old official capitalization, and as of Haxe 2.09, the capital X is no longer part of the language name. It is now just Haxe.
fields.summary: Capitalization of Haxe

fields.description:
I've been experimenting with the new inline commenting for pull requests (great feature, by the way).  Right now it generates a lot of e-mail traffic for the members of our team since each comment generates an e-mail notification.

It would be much better if only one e-mail were sent out, possibly via a time-out or by being able to batch-submit inline comments.
fields.summary: Control e-mail notifications from inline pull request comments

fields.description: Dashboard not displaying accessible repository until at least one repository is flagged as favorite
fields.summary: Dashboard not displaying accessible repository

fields.description:
Tonight I came across a peculiarity in the new interface...

I had a branch which contained 54 commits. I deleted this branch as it was no longer required. In our local repo, and in BitBucket, everything went well. The branch was removed as I'd expect.

Viewing the BB 'News Feed' I see each of the 54 commits reported as removed (see image '1 - Branch deleted.jpeg'). Again, this is what I'd expect.

However, when I now go to browse the commits on that repo I see something I wouldn't expect. The whole first page (i.e. the first 30 commits) is blank. The second page shows only 6 commits instead of 30 (i.e. for a total of 54 'empty' lines). From page 3 onwards, everything looks as normal.\\
So, it looks like the branch we deleted and its commits are indeed gone but the browse commit is still counting them as being there (see images 2 and 3).

Just to reiterate: the repo itself is perfectly ok and functional i.e. there is no corruption or anything else wrong, it is only the display.
fields.summary: Deletion of branch confuses commit browser - empty pages shown (BB-6169)

fields.description:
In the past, running 'hg qclone https://bitbucket.org/.../pq' would clone the main repository and then clone the patch queue repo in .hg/patches. It appears that this is no longer the case. The same 'hg qclone' command now clones just the patch queue repo and then clones the same repo in .hg/patches.

The main repository is never actually cloned, like it used to be. Is this the new intended behavior?
fields.summary: qclone patch queue doesn't clone main repository anymore (BB-6168)

fields.description: neda se prihlasit. byla jsem stale prihlasena, odhlasilo me to a neda se prihlasit
fields.summary: nefunguje prihlaseni

fields.description: I can not push any of my shared repositories in our team. No one can.
fields.summary: Unable to push to any repo's within my team

fields.description:
I think it would be a great addition if you were to have a filter on the newsfeed to allow you to filter between the following:\\
1.Your friends updates\\
2.Your personal updates\\
3.your team updates

I think this would be possible through a simply toggle, or dropdown.

Cheers.
fields.summary: Filter on Dashboard newsfeed (BB-2821)

fields.description:
I would like to see that Bitbucket doesn't destroy the case of my Git repo name. If I decide to name my repository eg. 'MyCoolCustomControl' on creating it and Bitbucket give me a URL like:

https://phranck@bitbucket.org/phranck/mycoolcustomcontrol.git

then it is not the thing I was expecting to get.\\
The reason is quite simple: If I develop reusable components (in my example this is MyCoolCustomControl control) I'm aware of using camel case, because it's related to the (main) class name of this component. So, if someone clone it from Bitbucket the root directory of this local repo will have the wrong case.
fields.summary: Use of CamelCase in repo name on Git repo URL

fields.description:
Hi guys,

this is a draft for a new broker that replaces CIA.vc (which died a few weeks ago and it is doubtful if it comes back) for IRC commit announcements.

Since irker is a distributed service, the broker requires an instance of the irkerd daemon by ESR (see http://www.catb.org/esr/irker/) running somewhere at bitbucket.
fields.summary: Broker for irker (IRC commit announcement service) (BB-6170)

fields.description:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags origin develop:develop master:master\\
Pushing to https://rcalder@bitbucket.org/dlabdirectv/ngwp.git\\
fatal: https://rcalder@bitbucket.org/dlabdirectv/ngwp.git/info/refs not valid: is this a git repository?\\
Completed with errors, see above
fields.summary: I am unable to push to any of my repositories.

fields.description:
Hi,

I really like the new, clean look of Bitbucket.

One UI tweak I'd like is to see the logged in username displayed in the UI, like in other Atlassian tools. I use two accounts (one for my organization and one for myself) and I'd like to easily know which one I'm currently using.

Thanks!\\
Makr
fields.summary: login username not displayed in UI

fields.description: Hello. I just signed up for a new Bitbucket account and also created a team account. I am not being sent the confirmation email and have a warning about it at the top of my pages. I checked spam and have not received the email in spam either. Please confirm my account.
fields.summary: Not being sent confirmation email

fields.description:
In https://bitbucket.org/dvarrazzo/psycogreen/src the link for README.rst points to https://bitbucket.org/dvarrazzo/psycogreen/src/be6cd3ae4b18/README.rst?at=master\\
even if commit 32cb37c has changed it.

The "recent activity" at https://bitbucket.org/dvarrazzo/psycogreen/overview reports the new commits. The homepage newsfeed too. The https://bitbucket.org/dvarrazzo/psycogreen/changesets page instead is stuck 3 commits behind.

These commits have been pushed about 16 hours ago.

Ticket BCLOUD-4844 probably depends on this.
fields.summary: In Source page file links point to stale versions

fields.description:
We have a large repo(around 4GB) up on bitbucket using mercurial. When we try to clone it it gives an error\\
files: 2985/6183 chunks (48.28%)\\
transaction abort!\\
rollback completed\\
abort: stream ended unexpectedly (got 14630119 bytes, expected 15066920)

Till now we have tried quite a few times, and actually it gets stuck at the same place every time. These are these video files in with extension .ogv.

Any help is appreciated !!
fields.summary: Need help cloning large repo.
